canonical_explanation.text: Line symmetry exists when a figure can be folded along a line so that both halves match exactly. This line is called the line of symmetry or mirror line. Regular polygons have multiple lines of symmetry, while some shapes have one or none. Reflection symmetry helps us complete figures by mirroring one half across the line of symmetry.
rules: A line of symmetry divides a figure into two identical halves that are mirror images
Some figures have multiple lines of symmetry (e.g., a square has 4)
A circle has infinite lines of symmetry passing through its center
To test for symmetry, fold the figure along the proposed line - both halves should match exactly
Regular polygons with n sides have n lines of symmetry

questions.question_text: What is a line of symmetry?

options.text: A line that divides a figure into two identical halves
A line that divides a figure into two different parts
A diagonal line in a figure

questions.explanation_correct: A line of symmetry is a line that divides a figure into two identical halves. When you fold the figure along this line, the two sides match exactly, like a mirror image.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A line of symmetry is not a diagonal line or the perimeter of a figure. It is a line that cuts the figure into two equal parts that are reflections of each other. Option B is incorrect because a line of symmetry does not divide the figure into different parts, but into identical halves.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a square have?
questions.explanation_correct: A square has 4 lines of symmetry. When you fold a square along any of its 4 sides, the two halves match exactly. This means a square has 4 lines of symmetry, one along each side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A) 2 lines of symmetry is incorrect because a square has 4 lines of symmetry, not 2. Option B) 3 lines of symmetry is also incorrect because a square has 4 lines of symmetry, not 3. Option D) 8 lines of symmetry is incorrect because a square has 4 lines of symmetry, not 8.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a regular hexagon have?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular hexagon has 6 lines of symmetry, so the correct answer is C. This is because a regular hexagon has 6 equal sides and 6 equal angles, so it can be folded in 6 different ways along the lines to match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The regular hexagon has 6 lines of symmetry, not 3 or 4 or 12. This is because a regular hexagon has 6 equal sides and 6 equal angles, so it can be folded in 6 different ways along the lines to match exactly. Options A, B, and D are incorrect as they do not match the number of lines of symmetry for a regular hexagon.

questions.question_text: Which of the following letters of the English alphabet has exactly one vertical line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter M has exactly one vertical line of symmetry. If you fold the letter M in half vertically, the two halves will match perfectly, showing that it has one line of symmetry running down the middle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter Z does not have any lines of symmetry, as the two halves of the letter are not identical. The letter N also does not have any lines of symmetry, as the two sides are not the same. The letter F has one horizontal line of symmetry, but not a vertical line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A rectangle that is not a square has how many lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle that is not a square has 2 lines of symmetry. This is because a rectangle can be folded exactly in half along its length and its width, creating two equal halves that match perfectly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle that is not a square does not have 0, 4, or 8 lines of symmetry. A square has 4 lines of symmetry, but a rectangle that is not a square has only 2 lines of symmetry - one along the length and one along the width of the rectangle.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a circle have?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has an infinite number of lines of symmetry because it can be folded in half along any diameter (straight line passing through the center). This means the two halves will always match exactly, so a circle has an infinite number of lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because a circle does not have 0, 1, or 4 lines of symmetry. A circle has an infinite number of lines of symmetry since it can be folded in half along any diameter and the two halves will always match perfectly.

questions.question_text: Which everyday object typically shows bilateral symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A butterfly typically shows bilateral symmetry, which means that if you fold the butterfly in half along its body, the two halves will match exactly. This is an example of line symmetry, where the body of the butterfly acts as the line of symmetry or mirror line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An object that does not typically show bilateral symmetry is a spiral staircase. A spiral staircase is not symmetric because the two halves on either side of the central axis do not match exactly. In contrast, a butterfly's wings are symmetrical on either side of its body, which is the line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does an equilateral triangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry because it can be folded equally along any of its 3 sides. This means that when the triangle is folded along any of its sides, the two halves will match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An equilateral triangle is a regular polygon with 3 equal sides and 3 equal angles. Since it has 3 lines of symmetry, the correct answer is option C) 3. The other options are incorrect because an equilateral triangle does not have 1, 2, or 6 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: If point A is 3 units to the left of a vertical line of symmetry, where will its reflection point A' be?

options.text: 3 units to the left of the line
3 units to the right of the line

questions.explanation_correct: When a point is to the left of a vertical line of symmetry, its reflection will be 3 units to the right of the line. This is because the reflection is the mirror image of the original point across the line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The reflection of point A would not be 3 units to the left of the line, because that would mean the reflection is on the same side as the original point. The reflection is always the same distance from the line of symmetry, but on the opposite side. So the correct answer is that point A' will be 3 units to the right of the line.

questions.question_text: Which term is another name for a line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A 'mirror line' is another name for a 'line of symmetry'. This is the line that a shape can be folded along so that both halves match exactly. The mirror line acts as a reflection, allowing you to complete the shape by mirroring one half across it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct names for a line of symmetry. A 'diagonal line' is a line that connects two opposite corners of a shape. A 'parallel line' is a line that runs alongside another line, but does not intersect it. A 'perpendicular line' is a line that meets another line at a 90 degree angle. None of these describe the mirror line or line of symmetry in a shape.

questions.question_text: A line of symmetry divides a figure into two identical ___ halves.
questions.explanation_correct: A line of symmetry divides a figure into two identical mirror halves. This means that if you fold the figure along the line of symmetry, the two halves will match exactly, like a mirror image.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'mirror'. A line of symmetry divides a figure into two identical halves that are reflections of each other, like a mirror image. The two halves are not just 'identical' - they are mirror images that match when the figure is folded along the line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A regular polygon with 5 sides has ___ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A regular pentagon (a polygon with 5 sides) has 5 lines of symmetry. This is because when you fold the pentagon along any one of its 5 sides, the two halves match exactly. The lines that bisect each side of the pentagon are the lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is '5', which is correct. A regular pentagon has 5 lines of symmetry, not 3 or 10. This is because a regular pentagon has 5 sides, and you can fold it along any one of those 5 sides so that the two halves match exactly. The lines that bisect each side are the lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: An isosceles triangle has ___ line(s) of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: An isosceles triangle has 1 line of symmetry. This is because an isosceles triangle has two equal sides, and can be folded exactly in half along the line that bisects the triangle and passes through the vertex and the midpoint of the opposite side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is that an isosceles triangle has more than 1 line of symmetry. This is not correct because an isosceles triangle has only 1 line of symmetry, which is the line that passes through the vertex and bisects the opposite side. It cannot be folded in any other way to match the two halves exactly.

questions.question_text: The English capital letter 'H' has ___ line(s) of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The English capital letter 'H' has 2 lines of symmetry because when you fold the letter along the vertical line in the middle, as well as the horizontal line in the middle, both halves match exactly. This means the 'H' has 2 mirror lines where it can be perfectly reflected.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The English capital letter 'H' does not have just 1 line of symmetry. It actually has 2 lines of symmetry - one vertical line in the middle, and one horizontal line in the middle. When you fold the 'H' along either of these lines, the two halves match perfectly, showing that it has 2 mirror lines or lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A regular octagon has ___ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A regular octagon has 8 lines of symmetry because it is a polygon with 8 equal sides and 8 equal angles. When folded along any one of these 8 lines, the two halves match exactly, showing that the octagon has 8 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single number, '8'. An octagon does not have 4 or 6 lines of symmetry, as those would not match the regular, 8-sided shape. A regular octagon has 8 equal sides and 8 equal angles, so when folded along any of these 8 lines, the two halves match exactly, making the correct number of lines of symmetry 8.

questions.question_text: In reflection symmetry, both halves of a figure are ___ images of each other.
questions.explanation_correct: In reflection symmetry, both halves of a figure are mirror images of each other. This means that if you fold the figure along the line of symmetry, the two halves will match exactly, like a reflection in a mirror.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The missing word in the question is 'mirror'. In reflection symmetry, the two halves of a figure are mirror images of each other. This means that if you fold the figure along the line of symmetry, the two halves will match exactly, like a reflection in a mirror. The halves are not just similar or identical, but they are true mirror images of each other.

questions.question_text: A scalene triangle has ___ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle has 0 lines of symmetry because all its sides are different lengths. This means it cannot be folded exactly in half along any line to match both halves perfectly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is '0'. A scalene triangle does not have any lines of symmetry. This is because all the sides of a scalene triangle are of different lengths, so it cannot be folded exactly in half along any line to match both halves perfectly. Some other shapes, like regular polygons, have multiple lines of symmetry where they can be folded to match perfectly.

questions.question_text: The English capital letter 'A' has ___ line(s) of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The English capital letter 'A' has 1 line of symmetry because it can be folded along the middle line so that both halves match exactly. This middle line is the line of symmetry or mirror line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The English capital letter 'A' does not have 2 or more lines of symmetry. While some regular shapes like squares and equilateral triangles have multiple lines of symmetry, the letter 'A' only has 1 line of symmetry along the middle. Therefore, the correct answer is 1 line of symmetry for the letter 'A'.

questions.question_text: When completing a symmetric figure on a grid, each point on one side must be at an equal ___ from the line of symmetry as its corresponding point on the other side.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is 'distance' because in a symmetric figure, each point on one side of the line of symmetry must be at an equal distance from the line as its matching point on the other side. This is what allows the two halves of the figure to line up perfectly when folded along the line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single word, 'distance'. The reason 'distance' is the correct answer is that in a symmetric figure, the corresponding points on each side of the line of symmetry must be equidistant from the line. This means they are the same distance away from the line, which allows the two halves to match up perfectly when the figure is folded along the line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A rhombus (not a square) has ___ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A rhombus (not a square) has 2 lines of symmetry because it can be folded in half along either of its diagonals, and the two halves will match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be 1 line of symmetry. This is wrong because a rhombus (not a square) actually has 2 lines of symmetry. A rhombus can be folded in half along either of its diagonals, and the two halves will match exactly. So the correct answer is 2 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: A line of symmetry must always pass through the center of a figure.
questions.explanation_correct: A line of symmetry does not have to pass through the center of a figure. It can pass anywhere along the figure, as long as it divides the shape into two equal halves that match exactly when folded.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is a common misconception that a line of symmetry must always pass through the center of a figure. However, this is not the case. The line of symmetry can be located anywhere along the shape, as long as it divides the figure into two equal and matching halves when folded. The center of the figure is not a requirement for the line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: All regular polygons have at least one line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, all regular polygons have at least one line of symmetry. This is because regular polygons are shapes with equal sides and equal angles. When you fold a regular polygon along its center, the two halves will match exactly, showing that it has a line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is not correct. All regular polygons do have at least one line of symmetry. For example, a square has four lines of symmetry, a triangle has three, and a hexagon has six. The key is that regular polygons have equal sides and angles, allowing them to be folded in half and have the two sides match perfectly.

questions.question_text: A butterfly has multiple lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A butterfly does not have multiple lines of symmetry. It has only one line of symmetry that runs vertically down the middle, dividing the butterfly into two matching halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Many people think a butterfly has multiple lines of symmetry because the two wings appear to be identical. However, if you fold the butterfly along the middle line, the two halves will match exactly. This means a butterfly only has one line of symmetry, not multiple lines.

questions.question_text: A parallelogram (not a rectangle) has at least one line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A parallelogram (not a rectangle) does not have any lines of symmetry. This is because the two pairs of sides in a parallelogram are not equal, so the figure cannot be folded exactly in half to match on both sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students may think a parallelogram has at least one line of symmetry because the opposite sides are parallel. However, this is not enough for the figure to have a line of symmetry. For a shape to have a line of symmetry, the two halves must match exactly when folded along that line, which is not the case for a parallelogram.

questions.question_text: In reflection symmetry, the distance from any point to the line of symmetry equals the distance from its reflection to the same line.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, this statement is true. In reflection symmetry, the distance from any point to the line of symmetry is always equal to the distance from its reflection to the same line. This is because the line of symmetry acts like a mirror, and the reflected point is the same distance from the line as the original point.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is not false. In reflection symmetry, the distance from any point to the line of symmetry is always equal to the distance from its reflection to the same line. This is a key property of reflection symmetry, where the line of symmetry acts like a mirror and the reflected point is the same distance from the line as the original point.

questions.question_text: A circle has exactly four lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has infinitely many lines of symmetry. This means a circle can be folded along any diameter (line passing through the center) and the two halves will match exactly. There is no fixed number of lines of symmetry for a circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A common misconception is that a circle has exactly four lines of symmetry. This is not true. A circle is a special shape that has infinitely many lines of symmetry. You can fold a circle along any line passing through its center, and the two halves will match perfectly. So a circle does not have a fixed number of lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: The English capital letter 'Z' has no lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The English capital letter 'Z' has no lines of symmetry. This means that the shape of the letter cannot be folded exactly in half along any line to create two matching halves. The 'Z' is an asymmetric shape with no mirror lines.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement that the English capital letter 'Z' has no lines of symmetry is true. Some people might think the 'Z' has a line of symmetry running down the middle, but this is not the case. If you try to fold a 'Z' in half, the two halves will not match exactly, so there is no line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: All triangles have at least one line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: Not all triangles have a line of symmetry. Only certain types of triangles, like equilateral triangles, have one line of symmetry. Most other triangles, like right-angled or scalene triangles, do not have any lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not true that all triangles have at least one line of symmetry. This is a common misconception. Many triangles, like right-angled and scalene triangles, do not have any lines of symmetry. Only certain special triangles, like equilateral triangles, have one line of symmetry where the shape can be folded in half and the two sides match exactly.

questions.question_text: When completing a symmetric figure on a grid, if a point is 4 units above the horizontal line of symmetry, its reflection must be 4 units below the line.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is true because when a point is 4 units above the line of symmetry, its reflection will be exactly 4 units below the line. This is how reflection symmetry works - the distance from the line of symmetry is the same for a point and its reflection.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is incorrect because the distance of a point from the line of symmetry does not have to be the same as the distance of its reflection. The reflection can be at any distance below the line, as long as the overall shape is symmetric. For example, if a point is 4 units above the line, its reflection could be 2 units, 6 units, or any other distance below the line and still maintain the symmetry.

questions.question_text: Human faces are perfectly symmetrical.
questions.explanation_correct: Human faces are not perfectly symmetrical. If you fold a face in half, the two sides do not match exactly. There are small differences in the shape and placement of features like eyes, nose, and mouth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people think human faces are perfectly symmetrical because the two sides look very similar. However, if you look closely, you will see that the left and right sides of the face are not exactly the same. There are small differences in the size and position of features like the eyes, nose, and mouth. This means the face is not perfectly symmetrical along a single line.

questions.question_text: Arrange the steps to test if a figure has line symmetry, from first to last.
ordering_items: Draw a line through the figure
Imagine folding the figure along the line
Check if both halves match exactly
If they match, it is a line of symmetry
correct_answer: Draw a line through the figure
Imagine folding the figure along the line
Check if both halves match exactly
If they match, it is a line of symmetry
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is the logical steps to test if a figure has line symmetry. First, you draw a line through the figure. Then, you imagine folding the figure along that line. Finally, you check if the two halves match exactly - if they do, that line is a line of symmetry for the figure.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order mixes up the steps. You can't check if the halves match until after you have drawn the line and imagined folding the figure. The correct order is: 1) Draw a line through the figure, 2) Imagine folding the figure along the line, 3) Check if both halves match exactly, and 4) If they match, that line is a line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: Arrange these regular polygons in ascending order by their number of lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Equilateral triangle, Square, Regular pentagon, Regular hexagon because the number of lines of symmetry increases as the number of sides in the regular polygon increases. An equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry, a square has 4 lines, a regular pentagon has 5 lines, and a regular hexagon has 6 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to arrange the polygons in the reverse order, with the Regular hexagon first and the Equilateral triangle last. This is wrong because the number of lines of symmetry increases as the number of sides in the regular polygon increases. So the polygon with the fewest sides, the Equilateral triangle, should be first, and the polygon with the most sides, the Regular hexagon, should be last.

questions.question_text: Arrange the steps to complete a symmetric figure on a grid, from first to last.
ordering_items: Mark a point on one side of the line
Count its distance from the line
Plot the reflection at equal distance on the other side
correct_answer: Mark a point on one side of the line
Count its distance from the line
Plot the reflection at equal distance on the other side
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of steps is to first identify the line of symmetry, then mark a point on one side of the line, count its distance from the line, and finally plot the reflection at equal distance on the other side. This allows you to complete the symmetric figure by mirroring one half across the line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to first mark a point on one side of the line, then count its distance from the line, identify the line of symmetry, and finally plot the reflection at equal distance on the other side. This does not follow the logical order of steps needed to complete a symmetric figure. You need to first identify the line of symmetry before you can mirror points across it.

questions.question_text: Arrange these shapes in ascending order by their number of lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The shapes are arranged in ascending order by the number of lines of symmetry. A scalene triangle has no lines of symmetry, an isosceles triangle has one line of symmetry, a rectangle has two lines of symmetry, and a square has four lines of symmetry. This matches the correct answer of ['Scalene triangle', 'Isosceles triangle', 'Rectangle', 'Square'].
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect explanation would be that the shapes are arranged in descending order by the number of lines of symmetry. This is not correct because the order should be ascending, from the shape with the fewest lines of symmetry to the shape with the most. The correct order is ['Scalene triangle', 'Isosceles triangle', 'Rectangle', 'Square'], not the reverse.

questions.question_text: Arrange these letters in ascending order by their number of lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Letter P, Letter A, Letter H, and Letter O. This is because the letter P has 2 lines of symmetry, the letter A has 1 line of symmetry, the letter H has 1 line of symmetry, and the letter O has 0 lines of symmetry. Arranging them in ascending order based on the number of lines of symmetry gives us this correct order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be something like Letter H, Letter A, Letter O, Letter P. This is wrong because the letter P has the most lines of symmetry (2), followed by the letters A and H (1 each), and then the letter O (0). The correct order is to arrange the letters from the most lines of symmetry to the least.

questions.question_text: When reflecting a point across a horizontal line of symmetry, arrange these positions from highest to lowest on the vertical axis.
ordering_items: Original point 6 units above the line
Original point 2 units above the line
Reflection of point that was 2 units above
Reflection of point that was 6 units above
correct_answer: Original point 6 units above the line
Original point 2 units above the line
Reflection of point that was 2 units above
Reflection of point that was 6 units above
questions.explanation_correct: When reflecting a point across a horizontal line of symmetry, the distance of the reflected point from the line of symmetry is the same as the original point. So the points arranged from highest to lowest on the vertical axis would be the original points, followed by their reflections in descending order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to arrange the points in the reverse order, with the reflections first and then the original points. This is because when reflecting across a horizontal line, the reflected points will be the same distance below the line as the original points were above it. So the correct order is to have the original points first, followed by their reflections.

questions.question_text: Arrange these quadrilaterals in ascending order by their number of lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from least to most lines of symmetry is: General trapezium, Rhombus, Rectangle, Square. A general trapezium has no lines of symmetry, a rhombus has 2 lines of symmetry, a rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry, and a square has 4 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Rhombus, General trapezium, Rectangle, Square. This is wrong because a general trapezium has no lines of symmetry, while a rhombus has 2 lines of symmetry. A rectangle also has 2 lines of symmetry, and a square has the most with 4 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: Arrange the characteristics of a line of symmetry from most general to most specific.
ordering_items: It is a line in a geometric figure
It divides the figure into two parts
The two parts are identical in size
The two parts are mirror images
correct_answer: It is a line in a geometric figure
It divides the figure into two parts
The two parts are identical in size
The two parts are mirror images
questions.explanation_correct: The given characteristics are arranged from most general to most specific. A line of symmetry is first a line in a geometric figure. This line then divides the figure into two parts. These two parts are identical in size. Finally, the two parts are mirror images of each other on either side of the line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The characteristics are not arranged in the right order. The most general characteristic is that the line of symmetry is a line in a geometric figure. The next more specific characteristic is that this line divides the figure into two parts. The third characteristic, that the two parts are identical in size, is more specific than the previous two. The most specific characteristic is that the two parts are mirror images of each other on either side of the line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: Arrange the distances of reflected points from a vertical line of symmetry, from nearest to farthest.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is from nearest to farthest: Point on the line (0 units), Point 1 unit from the line, Point 3 units from the line, Point 7 units from the line. This is because the distance from the line of symmetry increases as you move farther away from it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to arrange the points from farthest to nearest. This is wrong because the line of symmetry is at 0 units, so the points closest to it should be listed first. The correct order is from nearest to farthest, starting with the point on the line of symmetry at 0 units.

questions.question_text: Arrange these regular polygons by the angle between consecutive lines of symmetry, from smallest to largest.
questions.explanation_correct: The angle between consecutive lines of symmetry for regular polygons decreases as the number of sides increases. So the order from smallest to largest angle is: Equilateral triangle (60 degrees), Square (90 degrees), Regular hexagon (120 degrees), Regular octagon (135 degrees).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to arrange the polygons from largest to smallest number of sides, like this: Regular octagon (8 sides), Square (4 sides), Regular hexagon (6 sides), Equilateral triangle (3 sides). However, this does not match the correct order of the angles between the lines of symmetry, which is the key factor in this question.

questions.question_text: What shape is Circle?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has an infinite number of lines of symmetry. This means that it can be folded along any diameter (line that passes through the center) and the two halves will match exactly. This makes the circle a shape with infinite lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options do not correctly describe the number of lines of symmetry for a circle. Option A (0) is incorrect because a circle has infinite lines of symmetry, not 0. Option B (3) is incorrect because a circle has more than 3 lines of symmetry. Option D (2) is incorrect because a circle has more than 2 lines of symmetry. The correct answer is option C, which states that a circle has an infinite number of lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What shape is Equilateral triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry, so the correct answer is C) 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An equilateral triangle is a regular polygon with 3 equal sides and 3 equal angles. Since it can be folded along 3 different lines to match exactly, it has 3 lines of symmetry. The other options are incorrect because 0 lines of symmetry is for irregular shapes, 2 lines of symmetry is for isosceles triangles, and infinite lines of symmetry is for a circle.

questions.question_text: What shape is Rectangle (not square)?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has 2 lines of symmetry, one along the midpoint of the longer sides and one along the midpoint of the shorter sides. This makes the correct answer D, which is 2 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square has 4 lines of symmetry, but a rectangle (which is not a square) has only 2 lines of symmetry. So the correct answer is not 3 or infinite, but 2 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What shape is Scalene triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle is a triangle with no lines of symmetry, so it has 0 lines of symmetry. This means that the triangle cannot be folded along any line to create matching halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct option is B, 0. A scalene triangle is a triangle with no equal sides and no equal angles. This means that it cannot be folded along any line to create matching halves, so it has 0 lines of symmetry. Options A, C, and D are incorrect because a scalene triangle does not have 3, infinite, or 2 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Letter H?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of Letter H is 2 because the shape has two lines of symmetry. A line of symmetry is a line that divides a figure into two equal halves that match exactly when folded along that line. The shape given has two such lines, so the answer is 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of Letter H is not 0, 1, or infinite. The shape has two lines of symmetry, so the correct answer is 2. If a shape has no lines of symmetry, the value would be 0. If a shape has only one line of symmetry, the value would be 1. But this shape clearly has two lines of symmetry, so the value of Letter H is 2.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Letter A?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of letter A is 1 because the line of symmetry divides the figure into two equal halves, so there is only one line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of letter A is not infinite, as that would mean the figure has infinite lines of symmetry. It is also not 0, as that would mean the figure has no lines of symmetry. The correct answer is 1, as the given figure has only one line of symmetry that divides it into two equal halves.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Letter O?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of Letter O is Infinite because the letter O has an infinite number of lines of symmetry. When you fold the letter O along any line passing through the center, both halves match exactly, so it has an infinite number of lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of Letter O is not A) 2, B) 1, or D) 0. The letter O has an infinite number of lines of symmetry because it is a perfect circle. You can fold it along any line passing through the center, and the two halves will match exactly. So the correct answer is C) Infinite.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Letter P?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of letter P is 0 because a shape with no lines of symmetry has 0 lines of symmetry. In other words, the shape cannot be folded along any line to match its two halves exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of letter P is not infinite, 1, or 2. A shape with no lines of symmetry has 0 lines of symmetry. This means it cannot be folded along any line to match its two halves exactly. So the correct answer is 0.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Regular pentagon?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of a regular pentagon is 5 because a regular pentagon has 5 equal sides and 5 equal angles. This means that a regular pentagon has 5 lines of symmetry, as it can be folded in 5 different ways to match both halves exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A regular pentagon has 5 sides and 5 angles, so the correct answer is 5. Option B (4) is incorrect because a regular pentagon is not a quadrilateral, which has 4 sides. Option C (6) is incorrect because a regular pentagon does not have 6 sides or 6 lines of symmetry. Option D (8) is incorrect because a regular pentagon does not have 8 sides or 8 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Regular hexagon?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular hexagon has 6 sides and 6 angles. Therefore, the value of a regular hexagon is 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of a regular hexagon is not 5, 8, or 4. A regular hexagon is a shape with 6 equal sides and 6 equal angles. This means the correct answer is 6, as there are 6 sides and 6 angles in a regular hexagon.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Regular octagon?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of a regular octagon is 8 because it has 8 sides. A regular octagon is a polygon with 8 equal sides and 8 equal angles, so the number of sides is 8.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of a regular octagon is not 6, 4, or 5. A regular octagon has 8 sides, so the correct answer is 8. A regular octagon is a special type of polygon with 8 equal sides and 8 equal angles, and the number of sides is the value that represents its shape.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Square?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 4. A square has 4 equal sides and 4 right angles, which means it has 4 lines of symmetry. The lines of symmetry bisect the square at the midpoints of the sides, creating 4 equal quadrants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because a square does not have 5, 8, or 6 lines of symmetry. Squares have 4 lines of symmetry, not the other values given in the options. This is because a square has 4 equal sides and 4 right angles, allowing it to be folded in 4 different ways to match the other half exactly.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it has line symmetry of Butterfly?
questions.explanation_correct: The butterfly shape has line symmetry because if you fold it along the middle line, both halves will match exactly. This line of symmetry in the middle is the mirror line that reflects one side onto the other side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The butterfly does not have line symmetry. This is because if you try to fold it along any line, the two halves will not match exactly. Line symmetry requires that the figure can be folded exactly in half, with both sides being identical mirrors of each other.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it has line symmetry of Maple leaf?
questions.explanation_correct: The maple leaf has line symmetry. You can fold the maple leaf along a line (called the line of symmetry or mirror line) so that both halves match exactly. This means the maple leaf has reflection symmetry, where one half is the mirror image of the other half.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The maple leaf does not have line symmetry. This is incorrect because the maple leaf can be folded along a line so that both halves match exactly. The maple leaf has reflection symmetry, where one half is the mirror image of the other half, which means it has line symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it has line symmetry of Spiral shell?
questions.explanation_correct: The spiral shell does not have line symmetry because it cannot be folded along a line so that both halves match exactly. The shape is not symmetrical across any line, so option A is correct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The spiral shell does not have line symmetry. Even though it may look like it has a curved line of symmetry, the two halves of the shell do not match perfectly when folded along that line. The spiral pattern makes the shell asymmetrical, so option B is incorrect.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it has line symmetry of Most tree branches?
questions.explanation_correct: Most tree branches do not have line symmetry. This is because the branches and twigs of a tree grow in an irregular, asymmetrical pattern, and cannot be folded along a line to match exactly on both sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people may think tree branches have symmetry because they appear to be similar on both sides. However, a closer look shows that the branches and twigs do not match exactly when folded along a line. Tree branches grow in an irregular way, without a clear line of symmetry, so the correct answer is that they do not have line symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Square?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of a square is 4 because a square has 4 sides of equal length. When we fold a square along its line of symmetry, the two halves match exactly, so the number of lines of symmetry for a square is 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of a square is not 0 or 2. A square has 4 equal sides, so the number of lines of symmetry is 4. Option A (0) is incorrect because a square has lines of symmetry, and Option C (2) is incorrect because a square has more than 2 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Rectangle?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of a rectangle is 2 because a rectangle has two lines of symmetry - one vertical line through the middle and one horizontal line through the middle. This means the rectangle can be folded in half along either of these lines and the two halves will match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of a rectangle is not 0 or 4. A rectangle has 4 sides but that does not mean it has 4 lines of symmetry. The correct answer is 2 because a rectangle can be folded in half along a vertical line and a horizontal line, giving it two lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Rhombus?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of a Rhombus is 2 because a rhombus has two lines of symmetry - the diagonals. When you fold the rhombus along either diagonal, the two halves match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of a rhombus is not 0 or 4. A rhombus is a quadrilateral with four equal sides, and it has two lines of symmetry - the diagonals. The correct value for the lines of symmetry in a rhombus is 2.

questions.question_text: What is the value of Trapezium (general)?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of the line of symmetry for a general trapezium is 0. This is because a general trapezium has no line of symmetry, as the two pairs of opposite sides are not equal in length.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 0, as a general trapezium has no line of symmetry. Options B and C are incorrect because regular polygons like rectangles and squares have 2 or 4 lines of symmetry, but a general trapezium is not a regular shape, so it has no line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of Mirror line?

options.text: Another name for line of symmetry
Has at least one line of symmetry

questions.explanation_correct: The mirror line is another name for the line of symmetry. This is the line that divides a symmetrical shape or figure into two equal halves that match exactly when folded along this line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The mirror line is the same as the line of symmetry. This line divides the shape in half, so that one half is a perfect reflection or mirror image of the other half. It is not about the distance from the line, or whether the shape has at least one line of symmetry. The mirror line is the key feature that makes a shape symmetric.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of Equidistant?

options.text: Has at least one line of symmetry
Another name for line of symmetry

questions.explanation_correct: Equidistant means that all points on one side of the line of symmetry are an equal distance from the line. This means that if you fold the shape along the line of symmetry, the two halves will match perfectly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A, 'Equal distance from the line'. Equidistant refers to being an equal distance from the line of symmetry, not having a line of symmetry (B), not being another name for line of symmetry (C), and not just mirroring one half (D). The key is that all points on one side are the same distance from the line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of Reflection symmetry?

options.text: Another name for line of symmetry
Has at least one line of symmetry

questions.explanation_correct: Reflection symmetry means that one half of the shape mirrors or copies the other half exactly across the line of symmetry. This is the definition of a shape with line symmetry, where the two halves are identical when folded along the mirror line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option D is correct because reflection symmetry refers to a shape having one line of symmetry, where one half of the shape is a perfect mirror image of the other half. Options A, B, and C do not fully capture the meaning of reflection symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the meaning of Symmetric figure?

options.text: Has at least one line of symmetry
Another name for line of symmetry

questions.explanation_correct: A symmetric figure has at least one line of symmetry. This means you can fold the figure along a certain line, and the two halves will match exactly. The line that the figure can be folded along is called the line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B is the correct answer. Option A, 'equal distance from the line', is not the definition of a symmetric figure. Option C, 'one half mirrors the other', is correct but incomplete - a symmetric figure must have at least one line of symmetry, not just mirror one half. Option D, 'another name for line of symmetry', is also incorrect - the line of symmetry is a separate concept from the definition of a symmetric figure.

questions.question_text: What shape is All sides equal (regular)?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular polygon, where all sides are equal, has multiple lines of symmetry. This means you can fold the shape along several different lines and the two halves will match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A regular polygon with all sides equal has multiple lines of symmetry. This is because you can fold the shape along different lines and the two halves will be identical. Option B (infinite lines of symmetry) is not correct, as even regular polygons have a finite number of lines of symmetry. Options C (one line of symmetry) and D (no lines of symmetry) are also incorrect, as a regular polygon has more than one line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What shape is Two equal sides (isosceles)?
questions.explanation_correct: An isosceles triangle has one line of symmetry, which is the line that bisects the triangle and passes through the vertex opposite the equal sides. This means that when the triangle is folded along this line, the two halves match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An isosceles triangle does not have infinite lines of symmetry or multiple lines of symmetry. It has only one line of symmetry, which passes through the vertex opposite the equal sides. Shapes with no lines of symmetry, such as scalene triangles, do not have any lines that can be folded so that the two halves match exactly.

questions.question_text: What shape is No equal sides (scalene)?
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle has no equal sides, so it does not have any lines of symmetry. This means it has no line that can be folded so that the two halves match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A shape with one line of symmetry can be folded along that line so that the two halves match exactly. Shapes with multiple lines of symmetry, like regular polygons, can be folded in different ways and still match. But a scalene triangle, which has no equal sides, cannot be folded to match on any line, so it has no lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What shape is Perfectly round?
questions.explanation_correct: A circle is perfectly round, which means it has an infinite number of lines of symmetry. This is because a circle can be folded along any line passing through the center, and the two halves will match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The shape with multiple lines of symmetry is a regular polygon, like a square or a hexagon. The shape with one line of symmetry is a rectangle or an isosceles triangle. The shape with no lines of symmetry is an irregular shape, like a parallelogram or a scalene triangle. A circle, being perfectly round, has an infinite number of lines of symmetry, which is why option C is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it has vertical line symmetry of Letter T?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter T has vertical line symmetry because if you fold it along the vertical line in the middle, the two halves will match exactly. This means the letter T has a line of symmetry running vertically through the center.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter T does not have vertical line symmetry. This is because if you try to fold the letter T along a vertical line, the two halves will not match exactly. The letter T has only one line of symmetry, which runs horizontally through the middle of the T.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it has vertical line symmetry of Letter B?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter B has vertical line symmetry. This means that if you draw a vertical line down the middle of the letter, the two halves on either side will be exactly the same, or mirror images of each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter B does have vertical line symmetry. This is because the two sides of the letter are identical, so if you fold the letter along a vertical line down the middle, the two halves will match up perfectly. The correct answer is that the letter B has vertical line symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it has vertical line symmetry of Letter S?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter S does not have vertical line symmetry. When you fold the letter S along a vertical line, the two halves do not match exactly. Therefore, the letter S has no vertical symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter S does not have vertical line symmetry. This means that if you fold the letter S along a vertical line, the two halves will not match exactly. The letter S is not symmetric along a vertical line, so option B is incorrect.

questions.question_text: What is the whether it has vertical line symmetry of Letter G?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter G does not have vertical line symmetry. If you try to fold the letter G vertically down the middle, the two halves will not match exactly. This means the letter G does not have a vertical line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter G does not have vertical line symmetry. Even though the letter G may look like it has a vertical line down the middle, if you try to fold it in half along that line, the two halves will not match exactly. This is because the tail of the G sticks out on one side, making the two halves different.

questions.question_text: What is the reflection across a vertical line of symmetry of 2 units left?
questions.explanation_correct: The reflection across a vertical line of symmetry means that the object is mirrored across the line, so it moves 2 units to the right. This is because the line of symmetry divides the object in half, and the other half is simply a reflection of the first half.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If an object is 2 units left of the line of symmetry, then the reflection of that object would be 2 units to the right of the line of symmetry, not on the line or 1 unit left. This is because the reflection is the mirror image of the original object, so it is the same distance from the line of symmetry but on the other side.

questions.question_text: What is the reflection across a vertical line of symmetry of 5 units left?
questions.explanation_correct: The reflection across a vertical line of symmetry is 5 units right because the image is mirrored or flipped to the other side of the line. So if an object is 5 units left of the line, its reflection will be 5 units right of the line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The reflection across a vertical line of symmetry is not on the line or 1 unit left. It is also not 2 units right. The correct answer is 5 units right because when an object is reflected across a vertical line, it is mirrored to the opposite side of the line, and the distance from the line of symmetry is the same on both sides.

questions.question_text: What is the reflection across a vertical line of symmetry of On the line?
questions.explanation_correct: The reflection across a vertical line of symmetry means that the shape is mirrored exactly across the line, so it remains on the line of symmetry. The shape does not move left or right, it stays in the same position on the line.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options suggest that the shape moves either to the right or to the left after reflecting across the line of symmetry. However, this is not correct. When reflecting across a vertical line of symmetry, the shape remains on the same line and does not shift left or right. It is simply mirrored, keeping its position on the line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What is the reflection across a vertical line of symmetry of 1 unit right?
questions.explanation_correct: The reflection of 1 unit right across a vertical line of symmetry would be 1 unit left, since the reflection flips the figure across the line of symmetry. This means the new position is on the left side of the line, not the right side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A, 2 units right, is incorrect because the reflection across the line of symmetry would move the figure in the opposite direction, not further to the right. Option C, 5 units right, is also incorrect because the reflection should only move the figure by 1 unit, not 5. Option D, on the line, is not correct because the reflection would move the figure to the other side of the line of symmetry, not on the line itself.

questions.question_text: What property is used to sort "Equilateral triangle"?
questions.explanation_correct: The equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry, so the correct property used to sort it is 'C) 3 lines of symmetry'. An equilateral triangle can be folded along 3 different lines (the 3 sides) so that both halves match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The equilateral triangle is a regular polygon, which means it has multiple lines of symmetry. Option 'A) 1 line of symmetry' is incorrect because an equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry, not just 1. Option 'B) 0 lines of symmetry' is also incorrect, as the equilateral triangle clearly has lines of symmetry that allow it to be folded in half.

questions.question_text: What property is used to sort "Isosceles triangle"?
questions.explanation_correct: The Isosceles triangle has 1 line of symmetry. This is because it can be folded in half along the line that bisects the triangle, and the two halves will match exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Isosceles triangle has 1 line of symmetry, not 0 or 3. This is because it can be folded in half along the line that bisects the triangle, and the two halves will match exactly. It is not a regular polygon, so it does not have 3 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What property is used to sort "Scalene triangle"?
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle has 0 lines of symmetry because all three sides are of different lengths. This means the triangle cannot be folded exactly in half along any line to match the two halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Scalene triangles do not have 3 or 1 line of symmetry. This is because all three sides of a scalene triangle are of different lengths, so it cannot be folded exactly in half along any line. Therefore, the correct answer is 0 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What property is used to sort "Right-angled isosceles"?
questions.explanation_correct: The right-angled isosceles triangle has 1 line of symmetry. This means that if you fold the triangle along the line dividing the two equal sides, the two halves will match exactly. This property is used to sort and identify this type of triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The right-angled isosceles triangle does not have 3 lines of symmetry. This is because it has only 1 line of symmetry - the line dividing the two equal sides. It also does not have 0 lines of symmetry, as that would mean the two halves of the triangle do not match when folded along any line.
